body_content.explanation: a connection between two people, things, or ideas:
examples: There's a direct link between diet and heart disease.
Their links with Mexico are still strong.
diplomatic links between the two countries

body_content.explanation: a connection between documents on the internet:
examples: Click on this link to visit our online bookshop.

body_content.explanation: one of the rings in a chain
to make a connection between two or more people, things, or ideas:
examples: The explosions are not thought to be linked in any way.
The use of CFCs was linked to the depletion of the ozone layer.

body_content.explanation: to connect two objects or places physically:
examples: It can play MP3 music files and can be linked to an iPod with an extra lead.
Turkey, because of its location linking the European and Asian continents, has become a primary transit point for the efforts.

body_content.explanation: to make a connection with a website, social media post, video, etc. on the internet:
examples: We will link to this post from the project website.
She linked a video about finding work on social media.
